intro: Ledocarpon pedunculare, commonly known as the hooked bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Ledocarpon pedunculare is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in mountainous areas of Europe.
